text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise that a post-termination non-compete for a Managing Director (Gesch\u00e4ftsf\u00fchrer) requires the company to pay compensation under German law to be legally enforceable. The candidate answer mentions founder non-competes in Tier 3, stating: \"Broad founder non-compete beyond statutory limits \u2014 German courts are restrictive on post-termination non-competes (\u00a7 138 BGB, \u00a7 1 GWB); a 2-year non-compete is the practical maximum and must be reasonable in scope.\" This addresses founder non-competes generally, not specifically the requirement for compensation for a Managing Director's post-termination non-compete as mandated by German law (which typically requires compensation under \u00a7 72a HGB or general principles for enforceability).
